website_summaries.verdict: A great mechanical keyboard that has many of the same features as other gaming keyboards but for a lower price.
pros: Comfortable to type on thanks to the integrated palm rest
Bottom grips keep the keyboard in place
cons: Doesn't have as many options as other more expensive gaming keyboards

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Best Keyboard I have ever owned. I have had CM Storm and Razer keyboards, and this Logitech G213 Prodigy Gaming Keyboard is by far the best and my favorite keyboard to date, and not over-priced either (cough Razer!). The color zoning is great, especially when gaming, which I ended up finding more useful than anticipated. The software, not required but recommended, is intuitive, but very lite and unobtrusive. We all have different want, needs, and likes, but for me this keyboard hit the mark.
customer_reviews.author: Dick

customer_reviews.title: Tying not working correcty
customer_reviews.text: We Id ie t give this eybard a review but it's not tying correcty as ranmy keys just wnt register as I'm sure you've noticed. Other than that seems fine so far, and I can't figure out exacty why it ony haens every now and again, but this reviews is an exame of it's defectivity so hoe I can get this replaced son.
customer_reviews.author: asher wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Logitech G213
customer_reviews.text: I am afraid that, I cannot recommend this product...very difficult to utilize the software that must be downloaded (250mb) in order to configure the keyboard lighting feature...as for the keyboard itself, the mechanical keying is very imprecise, I would even say "sloppy"...and definitely not for a touch-typist...keyboard constantly misreads key strikes...all-in-all a very frustrating experience, and not indicative of Logitech products from my experience...not recommended...jo'c
customer_reviews.author: John M. O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard stops receiving input after 2 months of use; I am not a gamer- I bought this by looking at spill resistant keyboards thinking it will come with an increase in lifespan and greater durability. I will look into the warranty but amazon tech support tells me it is >60 days so I need to contact logitech personally--did not expect this poor quality from logitech.
customer_reviews.author: busy bee student

customer_reviews.title: Should last more than 5 months...
customer_reviews.text: While I loved this keyboard, it should last more than 5 months. Saturday (5.25.2019) it started randomly activating the 'sticky keys' function in windows. (if you don't know what sticky keys is, it's keyboard shortcuts without having to press control or the windows key, you lose the normal function of those keys) I only realized it was the keyboard after switching back to my old dell keyboard. Just know if you purchase this, it's not going to last.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: RGB Lighting is disappointing - Designed for SUPER casual gamer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to replace my cheaper non-RGB lit keyboard, and I'm honestly underwhelmed by this one. The RGB is not individually lit (which is something that isn't glaring in the item description), is limited to 5 vertical slices for RGB, and the overall brightness leaves a lot to be desired. Especially when paired with a G203 mouse which is BRIGHT in comparison. This is an overwhelmingly average gaming keyboard and for the price isn't terrible, the multimedia keys are a welcome addition even, however I'd recommend putting your extra dollars into a non-RGB Keyboard with better switches or multimedia options.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hupfeld

customer_reviews.title: BEST. KEYBOARD. EVER
customer_reviews.text: One of the best keyboards I've ever owned. Smooth and responsive. Better than than the loud clickitity klak "mechanical" keyboards. If you like near silent typing and smooth responsive key strokes then this is for you. Cant say how well it holds up but it feels solid and I've owned other logitech keyboards and nice and controllers and NONE have failed...I have some 20+ years old. I doubt this will either. For less than half the price of super annoying mechanical keyboards (heck if you like mechanical keyboards I would give this bad boy a try), this is a clear winner. Would give extra stars if I can!
customer_reviews.author: M.P.I.

customer_reviews.title: The Logitech software sucks! Plus RGB lights barely work after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this keyboard as part of a budget PC build almost a year ago, (August 2018). At first it was nice and hasn't given me a lot of problems until recently, the RGB lights started to flicker while playing a game and would then go out. Plus it's like it takes a second to register my keystroke occasionally. The worst thing about it is the Logitech G Hub software, its absolute trash and annoying to use cause it barely holds your presets most of the time and won't even load up all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Blake Prickett

customer_reviews.title: Goes wrong in so many ways
customer_reviews.text: It certainly wasn't a bargain when I factor in the time spent trying to get it configured and working. I had to find solutions on the web because the support at Logitech was so bad. The base is heavy, the keys are squirelly, so all in all, not my cup of tea.
customer_reviews.author: Vicster

customer_reviews.title: The keys feel good and are slightly more quiet than my G710
customer_reviews.text: Minimalistic design but still has everything I need. The keys feel good and are slightly more quiet than my G710. I use a G13 game panel for most of my games so i did not need the extra macro keys (and bulkiness) of the G710+. If you rely on those keys do not buy this keyboard. Lighting is nice and the media controls are excellent. Just a solid product with a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Random Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again or recommend to friends
customer_reviews.text: Works great for gaming. Only improvement would be if you could set the backlight color to return to your chosen color without needing to run the background app. If you close the app or set it to not start when windows starts, the keyboard goes back to rainbow spectrum. Having the option to disable the Windows key while gaming is worth this minor pet peeve. I bought this model to replace a Logitech G11 that lasted more than 7 years until it failed to register with my system after a liquid spill dried overnight. I like that I can change the color to match other peripherals instead of having several different glows. Satisfied Logitech user for over 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: It requires software to be installed to control the lighting.
customer_reviews.text: Without software installed, the colors are just constantly changing. While it might look cool to children, It is very uncomfortable to use it this way. When comes to gaming, the keyboard has 12 programmable keys. Unfortunately those are Function keys. To switch function keys from being ordinary F1-F12 to programmable button, a special button next to F12 needs to be pressed. It work the same way as Caps Lock, Num Lock or Scroll Lock. The disadvantage is that if your game requires the use of Function keys, to use programmed macros you have to constantly switch their mode. A set of dedicated keys would work much better than adding dual functionality to Function keys.
customer_reviews.author: wk

customer_reviews.title: HOT GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.text: "Fresh" out of the box this thing had stuck to semi responsive keys and a cheap feel, which I tried to adjust to over a practice session of a game when I started to feel sick. It took about 10 or so minutes for me to realize I was building to an allergy attack (which hit me pretty hard), now not to gross anyone out but I'm allergic to roaches so needless to say stuck keys roach motel keyboard is going back to logitech and I'm not buying anymore stuff from them.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Whyte

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard makes a high-pitched sound when the light is on
customer_reviews.text: The backlight electronics make a high-pitched sound when turned on. Especially annoying when the colors cycle because the pitch changes, making it hard to tune out. Its manual controls are non-existent, you need to download their software to change colors. That software is over 200Mb of bloatware and tries to connect to the internet for some reason. It also doesn't allow you to reassign anything but the Fxx keys - I don't remember the last time I actually needed media control buttons, I was hoping to reassign them for more common tasks. The keys are nice - not too clicky but still provide nice feedback when pressed.
customer_reviews.author: S P

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Crap
customer_reviews.text: This thing misses keystrokes all of the time. I've already bashed it into pieces out of sheer rage. The thing out of the box would skip keys and screw me over in gaming. It's completely inferior to mech keyboards. I only used it this long because my wife would get annoyed at my mech KB clicks, but I've switched back and I'm so happy to be free of this garbage. Not durable at all, misses clicks, not good for fast clicking.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice keyboard and it was a decent price since I got it on discount. My only issue is it doesn't save my colour settings. Which is occasionally an issue if I need to hard reboot the computer or if the computer happens to turn off unexpectedly (ex: power outage). It doesn't happen enough that it's a major issue but it is annoying to have to redo the colours and remember the RGB numbers for what I like. Also, some colour combos on certain keys look faded or dying. So if you have a static setting certain colours will look better in certain areas than others.
customer_reviews.author: MarinA

customer_reviews.title: Lighted keys work well if you download the required app.
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of the keys, but the reason I bought it was the lighted keys. This keyboard allows the user to set the color of the lighted keys with a downloadable driver, and that works as advertised. The problem I have is I am using this keyboard with my work laptop when working at home and I cannot download the driver onto that PC, so the keyboard lights continually change color in a demo mode. This is still better than no backlit keys, but not what I was expecting. It would have been nice if there was some control of the lights on the keyboard without having to use your computer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tallman

customer_reviews.title: No problems, satisfying keys (like an analog IBM or Dell)
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. I was certainly skeptical at first with all the reviews of broken or non-functional keys, so that was the first thing I tested. I'm happy to say they passed the test. So that aside, I'm very happy with the price and performance from this keyboard. It's keys have that classic feel without the delay. It lights up properly so I can see it at night and dims like it ought to so I'm not blinded by it either. If you get one broken, I'd try to get it replaced unless that's too much to handle. Your bound to get a good one at some point and I think it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Software junk
customer_reviews.text: The software on this keyboard would not load. Customer service was nonexistent. The feature to disable windows worked so well it permanently locked me out of my windows account. after hours of trying to get back in, I had to make a new account and delete my original. A major pain. Since there was no response from Logitech's help I don't know if there was an easier fix or not. My advice, spend your money elsewhere. There are a lot better keyboards at this price range with a service dept. that will actually respond to you.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's not the greatest keyboard ever , but it completes my matching setup , and it all uses the same app to control effects , and other functions. The multimedia works , but I don't use it that often. It has a built-in wrist rest , which cannot be detached , this might not be the greatest feature ever if you have a small space. It makes the keyboard pretty wide. You can set it to whatever color you like , there's even zones , it's not the brightest , but as you can see from the pic , it's very decent looking , and doesn't just make you stare at the lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular keyboard
customer_reviews.text: oh man oh man..... Where do I start? I had a high expectation of this keyboard and it still does not disappoint me. The typing and how the keys are so soft and easy to type. Its a great product and a great investment that I made. The light up of the keys are so beautiful also! However, I've seen videos of other people able to adjust certain keys to specific colors on how they want it to be but I have yet to figure it out. All in all, great product and highly recommend people to think about investment! Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level gaming keyboard with RGB lighting.
customer_reviews.text: Primary use: Gaming and typical PC use. The Pros: Its cheap, it works, custom RGB lighting. Media volume control, on/off RGB switch. You can set custom macros/micros (eh, how ever you spell it, but you know what I mean) The Cons. Its not mechanical, no cherry mx, but you should have known that for this price. Duh. Really there is zero cons about this, for this price range. Side Notes: Coming from a gaming laptop user to desktop, this is way better no matter what. You have to download the Logitech G Hub to have full control of the RGB and other functions.
customer_reviews.author: A. Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Good action on the keys and quiet as well
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect from a "gaming" keyboard but I was impressed with the quality of the keys and how quiet they are. I use this on a Mac with OSX and Windows 10 running on VMware Fusion and it works flawlessly in both operating systems. The color control software could be better but you don't even need it to run in static color modes which is nice. I have it set to a slow color wave and it's not distracting and makes the keys easy to pick out in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. H

customer_reviews.title: My new go to keyboard, fingers crossed I don’t ever need another!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it for gaming yet (will update if and when I do). For the most part, using it to type and will be used for online homework, so far so good! I love that there’s a function to turn the backlit light off, I love the feel of the keys as I type and the ease of using the keyboard (customizing the backlit colors). Overall very happy with this purchase, it’s my first rgb backlit keyboard and I’m very impressed and satisfied with the product!
customer_reviews.author: Julio Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Not so good enough.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Happy 13 year old... for now. Sadly this did not last long. This was given to our son as an Xmas present and unfortunately already 3 of the keys do not work. Tried getting ahold of the company and they said they are not responsible of purchases through a 3rd party. Which is really a huge slap on the face given that this keyboard is used perhaps no more than twice a week and for no more than a few hours each time. So given that it was used starting Dec 25th this flat out sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Hoffmann

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic feel and look and wonderful color
customer_reviews.text: I am a digital artist and the gaming part of the keyboard is fun too but wasn't the main reason I bought it. I love color, the way you can program it in different color styles and movement are very cool. I love the heaviness of it and the feel after hours working on digital art, I adore this thing. I have just started to program keys so look forward to seeing what I can do. I love Logitech products for their good quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: MarshaLeigh

customer_reviews.title: Has stood the test of time!!!! Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has stood the test of time! Bought this back in august of 2018. It has been dropped, soda and water spilled on and left in, used every day. And it still works perfect! Just as if I had gotten it! All lights still work and look amazing. I really take for granted the spill proof design, knowing it can take a spill of water or soda and not bother it really makes it for me! I can see this keyboard going for another 2 years before I need to replace it! And when I do this is the one I’m getting again! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard with one exception
customer_reviews.text: My oem keyboard died and I needed a quick replacement. I wanted illuminated keys for working without turning on a lot of lights. I also wanted a keyboard that would have a good angle for desktop work. I did not need or want a wireless keyboard. I'm not a gamer but this was the best choice I could find. The key action is very responsive and feels good but I could live without the weird fonts. Some of the symbols on the number keys are nearly illegible. Other than this, it is a great keyboard. Typing is a pleasure. Without the funky font on the keys it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Cath Secour

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at several rgb keyboards including many that were more expensive than the Logitech G213. I am very happy with the G213 as it has all the features and functions that I wanted. First it was rgb but not obnoxiously bright and "in your face". The letters on the keys have the rgb colors but there is not a bright backlit base that many of the other rgb keyboards had. The feel on the keys is awesome and the right side of the keyboard has multi-media functions. Lastly I downloaded the software and you can program this keyboard in many ways. There are macros and lighting options that suit all the ways that I use a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: HOWARD W FULP JR

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: shift key and 0 on the keyboard stopped working after 1 month
customer_reviews.author: David Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for low-light surroundings, & very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: A suggestion, in case Logitech reads these reviews: you need to publish a standalone installer for the G-Hub. I don't use these keyboards for gaming, and in one environment I work in, the over-the-internet installer is blocked. The keyboard is comfortable, with an ample wrist pad. Key presses aren't noisy. The backlighting does the trick for me; I don't like to turn on the room lights when I'm working at night.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schultz (ExchangeMaster-dot-com)

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. I am super picky about my keyboard and I can definitely say this one is my favorite. I don't care for the RGB, but it works well as a keyboard. The spacing is pretty good between keys. They also almost feel a little mechanical like for a price a lot less than one. I had problems with keys sticking, but Logitech sent me a new one quickly without even making me return the defective keyboard. The replacement is great. I am satisfied with this keyboard and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SirMonkeyV

customer_reviews.title: No clickity-clackity keys
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for use at work. Nice travel to the keys with no overtly loud 'clacking' that you'd get from a mechanical keyboard (I'm personally a fan of how mechanical keys sound but it would drive co-workers crazy). The RGB backlight is crisp and clear, but was also a non-factor for my buying decision. Probably not the keyboard a hardcore/competitive gamer would want, but more than sufficient for typical work use.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: really satisfying keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is great, the key caps are matte black and really sexy. The lighting is not my cup of tea, but it still looks amazing. Even though this is a membrane keyboard, the clicks it makes when typing are someone mechanical and really satisfying to type with. The volume control saves me a few seconds, but I have no idea what the fast forward/rewind buttons are for. The arm rest doesn't really do anything but it does add a nice weight to the keyboard. The little stands on the back are good if you like your keyboard tilted.
customer_reviews.author: yesnt

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is built well and has great features. I really dig the gamer button as it locks out the windows and menu button so if you hit them by accident while gaming nothing will happen. Really dig how these keys feel on my fingers. If any of my friends ever need a keyboard I'll be recommending this.
customer_reviews.author: Gesokuten

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard But...
customer_reviews.text: My biggest problem with it is that it is so perfect and it it has one problem only. It feels better than most expensive keyboards, it has a volume control, the keys are smooth, but, it doesn't have a way to color keys separately, or individually. You can only change the color of all the keys or groups of keys.
customer_reviews.author: 0v3rkill

customer_reviews.title: Not a G11, but decent gaming board.
customer_reviews.text: 30 year gamer here needed to finally replace my coveted G11 lost it's rgb and had a weak enter key. Non click keys aren't noisy and the colors are nice and best used through the keyboard software. Bad thing about this keyboard is in normal WoW usage i find the keyboard pulling off desk in the left front corner from wasd use. This is no G11, but it is a decent sub replacement. Let's hope G11 comes back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kerr

customer_reviews.title: RGB keyboard
customer_reviews.text: A really nice Keyboard... The feel: Is not the mechanical keyboard you are maybe expecting but despite is a membrane keyboard Logitech made a really good job in the feeling. The lighting: Well, this keyboard looks awesome in the dark or in the light. There is not a cheap bar led on it, each key has the perfect color without irritating your eyes when typing or gaming. Media control are a PLUS, the software to control the lights is very nice, the cord of the keyboard is very good, is mesh not the typical usb plastic cable. In general, you get a nice keyboard for the money you are paying.
customer_reviews.author: Huáscar Almonte (( r H a L Tech™ ))

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a mechanical keyboard before but i assume that's what this is. Bought it for a quick replacement but it's become my main over my old razer chroma. I got tired of using razer's weird software that didn't interact well with some games like ESO, and had a high pitch noise coming out of it. The keys are satisfying (a bit loud), response is good, and you don't need to run any software for the lighting. nice and simple. only downside is that you can see the lights through the keys and makes it look a bit cheap. it doesn't really show on camera, so no photos attached.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels good and sturdy with a nice click
customer_reviews.text: The low price initially made me question the quality of this keyboard compared to other more expensive mechanical gaming keyboards out there. While the lighting may not be as advanced as those options the Logitech G213 looks good and feels just as wonderful to type on. The keys are perfectly responsive with a nice click. They seemed a little loud at first but I soon got used to it. The wrist rest is an added bonus. I've noticed since using this keyboard that my gaming sessions last longer with less wrist strain, no doubt due to this ergonomic design. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tiare Mamalias

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard with fantastic lighting options. Logitech is my go-to for gaming keyboards. I also own a Logitech G710+, which is a mechanical keyboard with Cherry MX "brown" switches. In comparison to the mechanical models, the G213 is much quieter, but still with a comfortable action, even for a non-mechanical keyboard. Additionally, the G213 is more compact, which makes it better as a keyboard to be packed into a laptop case or luggage. The lighting options really are superb, and Logitech's included customization software is not a resource hog like some gaming software.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie Sovis

customer_reviews.title: Great with Minor Inconveniences
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Great keyboard for gaming -RGB colors are true and quite bright! -Comes with Game mode which allows you to turn off certain keys like the windows key and more! -quick keyboard volume control -great feeling when pressing keys, and quick response! Cons: - software tends to have a hiccup. ( game mode would randomly make other keys not work during game play, needing you to turn it on/off to work.) -quality is a bit flimsy. -rarely the keys would get stuck until you mess with it until it works again. Overall great keyboard for gaming or any other activity! Would watch this for deals as they're quite common with Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew O

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent keyboard and it does its job nicely. The LEDs are a blast to customize and ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent keyboard and it does its job nicely. The LEDs are a blast to customize and you are given multiple zones to work with, allowing you to customize the layout to your needs. Our only beef with this one was that the keys were about loud for our preferences. Quick and zero delay, sure. But also loud and distracting if the noise of your environment is of any concern. Beyond that, that's it. It's a good keyboard for gaming or anyone else looking for a keyboard for a fun looking custom rig.
customer_reviews.author: Poc Network // Tech

customer_reviews.title: Half way between, decent and pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It's a good, well-made, standard keyboard for people who don't care about desktop macro keys. I got it because I wanted the RGB and dedicated media keys. Which unfortunately only work for some apps. Pros: Strong/Well-made Satisfying keyboard "tack-tack" typing Much RGB, very wow Macros for in-game custom config <-- haven't tried yet Dedicated desktop app media control keys (vlc, itunes, etc) Cons: No macros for the price Media keys don't seem to work for browser use Quite loud
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Bought for the backlit keys
customer_reviews.text: Retired, with eyes that seem to need more light nowadays. Bought primarily to get backlit keys, and they work very well. Don't need all the fancy gaming features, and had to load a pretty big app to set the key color to the pleasing green it has now. Only "wish" is that the keyboard would remember the color setting through a power cycle. Great price for the function I DO use.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysBusy

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD FOR GAMING
customer_reviews.text: Terrible experience. I find myself CONSTANTLY reinstalling the Logitech Gaming Software which will not update no matter how many different ways I’ve tried. The keyboard also glitches, so I playing Fortnite for example will continuously run in a direction for no reason at all (no I don’t have auto run on) also to add on top of that sometimes the keys will not register when needed. All around terrible keyboard, another Logitech item that let me down
customer_reviews.author: Chrees

customer_reviews.title: Glad I picked this one over similar models.
customer_reviews.text: I am a gamer, and a transcriptionist. This KB is great for both. Excellent key return, LOVE the colors and the way I can program them, and the ability to make macros and program the keys for gaming. It's kinda pseudo-mechanical, so it's got a lot of travel for keys, they're spaced a bit, and they aren't quiet. If you're looking for an old-school KB with a lot of bells and whistles, for a really good price, this one passes my test. The cloth covered cord is also a good thing, the normal plastic ones just seem so flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Foxtato

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice keyboard for the average gamer. I play several times a week and really like the responsiveness and feel. The RBG works great and helps in the dark. I’m no pro but this is a great value for the money. Paired with a Logitech mouse and your set. I got the less expensive G203 and it’s fantastic for my game play. I play mostly FPS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Amazon reviewers and Logitech!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this keyboard based on Amazon reviews and so far I am totally happy with this product. The software alone is amazing with just about every imaginable feature you could want. The feel of the keyboard is great. I can't believe Logotech was able to deliver such a great product at such a low price. I can't speak to longevity as I have just started using this product but even if it only lasts a years I'll buy another one and be happy!
customer_reviews.author: D. Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: As a daily gamer, i recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. I didn't realize until after i ordered that it wasn't mechanical. But i figured I'd give it a try and im really happy i did. It almost feels mechanical, but not very noisy at all. Media buttons work great. Sectional backlighting looks really nice. Only complaint is no maco button. Which i never used much anyways. This keyboard is great, especially at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: AverageJoe

customer_reviews.title: Spread out the keys please!
customer_reviews.text: this keyboard is actually awesome. Super light touch, the sound buttons are perfectly placed, and the fading color was a bonus. Only reason i didn't give it 5 stars, is because the keys are placed too close to one another, maybe for a student. Even tho i have small petite hands, im constantly bumping in the middle in between them making mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena M.

customer_reviews.title: lighted keys
customer_reviews.text: The colors of the keys, of which none are to bright for the eyes, it's actually calming. The soft rotation of the color lighted letters keeps the board interesting. The key board it's self in high quality and the keys have a soft texture. I have had this key board for a wile, and I can't imagen not having it. I don't know how many years it will last so I'm buying another for a back up just in case something happens to it. Great Buy.
customer_reviews.author: sierwilliam

customer_reviews.title: Teenager Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: He thought he wanted a mechanical keyboard. He got this "membrane" keyboard instead. He loves it and surprised how tactile it really is, as it is very similar to the feel of a mechanical. Not exact, but not paying that price either. Is a good keyboard for the money, especially if you already own other Logitech RGB lighting enhanced devices.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun H.

customer_reviews.title: Pressure pressure pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing pains me more than having to smash a key into the back plate for it to register a press. If you play games or do heavy typing, the key pressure can get to be annoying. You might think that the force applied was more than enough to activate a key press, but it won’t. Unless you’re heavy handed I wouldn’t suggest purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Ed O

customer_reviews.title: Deep personalization feature!
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard! The colors are vibrant and if you know how to use the logitech software you personalize the color settings to a crazy detailed level. The volume buttons up top right corner is a great little feature to lower, increase, or mute the audio quicklu. Only downside is it gets occasionally uncomfortable at times in my left palm, especially if your gaming for a while, because the reach distance from the end of the keyboard to the wsad buttons are a bit much. If you like lots of colors and tons of personalization this is definitely for you! It's a solid gaming keyboard, just take some breaks to give your hands some rest!
customer_reviews.author: Preet

customer_reviews.title: Not really all that useful, but cool
customer_reviews.text: A very simple layout and functional, shorter than my old keyboard. The sounds of the key presses aren't loud at all, but still satisfying. The software allows you to change the colors in zones. Not really all that useful, but cool. I've not experienced any ghosting issues with it. Fingerprints are very noticeable against the black finish, but relatively easy to wipe off.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Generic knock-off
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard arrived in a black box. It looks to be a knock-off. Maybe that's why the cost was cheaper than the other ones I saw. No software with the keyboard, so I'll have to do some research if I want to make the lights work. 16.8 million lighting colors??? hahaha, try 1. The keyboard itself works fine, so I plan on keeping it. Just be aware, it's not a legit Logitech G213 keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Not for typists
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I work in the dark, and the light up keyboard was a real plus, and the volume control on top was a necessity for me. My issue is that compared to a normal keyboard the keys are smaller and don't seem standardly spaced. I realize this is a gaming keyboard, but I am constantly making spelling errors because I don't look at my fingers while typing. I am waiting to see if I can retrain my brain to the new keyboard, but I don't love it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Daley-Clark

customer_reviews.title: Some of the keys won't work
customer_reviews.text: It looks great, but a few of the keys don't work properly. You press down and they don't register on screen. You have to press some of the keys down in just the right spot with extra pressure to make them work. Really disappointed, first keyboard I've purchased that has ever had this issue. Disappointed with Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C

customer_reviews.title: A brilliant Keyboard to rival Razor.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my husband. Arrived quickly in a professional-looking box. It was easy to install the programme needed to change the colors - came with a great selection of effects. If you buy the mouse to match you can sync it so they do the effect at the same time. Has a great feel to it without the very heavy, loud clunking of similar mechanical keyboards. Great for any gamer!
customer_reviews.author: F T P

customer_reviews.title: Clacky Keys
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard from Logitech, replaced one that I had for over 10 years. The color options are very cool, and honestly good enough unless you're an intensive gamer and just have to have something more, that said, it'll cost you. For the price, the quality is excellent, but I guess the keys are a little clacky for my taste, but... they never promised silent keys, and I'm sure I will adapt. Certainly not a game changer. The wrist rest is a non-issue for me, but I've heard some people complain about it, that it is not removable. Logitech quality. In summary, I recommend this keyboard considering the caveats as seen above.
customer_reviews.author: E Robert Case

customer_reviews.title: False tactile response
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Feels great. LED control software easy to use. Palm rest is great. Cons: HOLY COW the misleading tactile response is TERRIBLE! I hate knocking on Logitech like this, but the tactile bump happens noticeably before the keystroke is recorded. The right control key has to be pressed HARD (well beyond the tactile bump) to register. I ended up taking the darn key off so I'd quit (failing at) using it. Also, the LED software struggles to reconnect on a laptop coming out of sleep mode - it leaves the keyboard completely unlit for some arbitrary amount of time until it decides to start working again.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, keys are quieeeettttt
customer_reviews.text: It is cool that you can customize the backlight colors etc, and I always appreciate having dedicated media keys. Combined with the surprisingly quiet keys, you have a great means of controlling videos for guests to set appropriate moods, and not wake them up while they're sleeping later heh heh aLLLright! Giggity.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Hwip

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Update: Absolute trash. Wish I used it more after purchase during warranty, too late to return. Colors are nice, but useless as a keyboard for typing. I have never had so many repeated characters with any other keyboard in my entire life. It is almost completely unusable having extra characters in almost every other word. I’ve purchased many logitech things in my life and they all worked great, this by far does not.
customer_reviews.author: JP-AmazonPen

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but the K55 is better
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is not a bad keyboard. However, in my personal opinion, the Corsair K55 feels better. The keystrokes seem to be slightly shorter on the K55 and the overall key stroke noise level is considerably less on the K55. As far as RGB, and this is completely subjective, the K55 is lit up more under the keys which i perfer (and a little less on the letters) where the G213 is only lit up on the key symbols (not illuminated under the keys). They are both good keyboards but at the time of this review the K55 is cheaper and I believe it is a better buy.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: Play/Pause buttons don't work or can't be programmed
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard for typing and CAD work. It's comfortable enough to long stretches of typing. The only complaint would be that I can't find out how to program the Play/Pause button to control a music media application. The LG software can control all sorts of things just not those buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I was using a pretty crappy keyboard before this but I knew what a good quality keyboard could really do. I was tired of the delay on my keys before and switching to this keyboard was amazing. I love the quality of it for the price and the look and feel of it. I love the LEDs on it as well as the way it feels pressing on a key. It is just what I was looking for while staying in my budget.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for 3 days and the rbg doesn't work properly anymore. disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Arielle D

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic membrane gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic membrane gaming keyboard, especially for the price. Keys feel great and are very quiet. Media controls feel perfect as well. Docking a 1/2 star for the non-removable wrist rest (but honestly, I love it), and another 1/2 star docked for the inability to control the LED lighting, or at least keep what's programmed, without the Logitech Gaming software opened. It's a perfect compliment to my Logitech G402 mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: This baby is smooth
customer_reviews.text: using it to type this out atm. it is silent enough to not bug my friends or randoms through the mic but loud enough to have that nice feedback feeling that mechanical keyboards provide. it has a decent length cord (pretty normal) and it braided so it will last longer. i was really excited about that to be honest.. has the same color features as the logitech mouse, which i own. and the colors are bright enough where it doesn't distract me from playing the game. honestly it's an amazing keyboard! im gonna order that same one later for a replacement somewhere down the line.. most likely far from now this baby is durable af!
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: BUTTER BABY!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW this keyboard is smooth as butter the feel is amazing i really love this keyboard feels amazing typeing great gaming im so glad i got this keyboard it is definately worth the money no buyers remorse here friends! volume controls feel a little laggy only con ive seen and im not sure thats not an issue with my audio driver or pc so if you think you might want it trust me friend you want regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Gamble

customer_reviews.title: 2 months and failed!
customer_reviews.text: my first attempt at becoming a pc gamer and this keyboard fail after 2 months of minor use. all of a sudden with no warning the mid section of the keys rgb lighting dimmed, buttons began activating by themselves, left shift stop working, scrolled for no reason. im very disappointed especially being in The Bahamas and paid so much to get this item here. when it worked i enjoyed learning the keys coming from a controller gamer but i was expecting to get more time out of this logitech highly recommended product. saddened
customer_reviews.author: Edward Burrows Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming keyboard on a budget!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price for an RGB keyboard on a budget. Great feel, keys are not going to be super clicky like Cherry MX however they don't feel quite mesh either. Software is easy to install and use and very straightforward. Awesome looking keyboard for sub $100 prices. If you want something simple and not bank breaking this is a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Patterson

customer_reviews.title: In Love
customer_reviews.text: In love with this keyboard. Feels great when I type on it (like now) True story only reason I am writing these reviews for all my items(I have been writing for the past hour) is cause of how great it feels typing on this keyboard. For gaming the keys are responsive and well spaced so there arent any mis clicks. The rgb looks great, the cable is quality and not flimsy. I coudnt be happier :) BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Lostagent23

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheap gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard. I have no complaints at all. I'm not a mechanical keyboard fanatic, so I can't comment how well it would compare to one of those. The one thing I wish it had was RGB lighting for individual keys, as opposed to the zones, but it's not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Brady

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, big keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard for gaming so I may be a bit biased. It has a great feel, the wrist rest is great, rpg lights can be setup to your liking which is a nice perk, I also use it to type work related documentation when I am working remotely. Overall I would say this is a great keyboard for the price. Cons: Logitech software is spotty, sometimes it does not save your lighting preferences Keyboard is a little on the bigger side but it should not deter you. I only list it as a con because the image may make the keyboard appear smaller than it actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos  Pena

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Especially for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my birthday and loved it since! Decent RGB capabilities. Lots of software features like programming the function keys. The key caps feel nice and overall build is very good. Typing feels about as good as you can get without getting a mechanical keyboard. Gaming is a big upgrade from most keyboards. I also really like the media control buttons. Design is also very clean. It's not too boring but not TOO gamer-y. Definitely recommend if you're looking at this price point. But get a mechanical if you're going above $100
customer_reviews.author: Tracy M Goode

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought
customer_reviews.text: Might be preference. There are so many good reviews. I just hate the key action. They are so tall from one row to the next my fingers drag and catch from row to row. I guess I just glide my fingers around the keyboard. Not high step them from key to key.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ruel

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the positive reviews...for the money, there is a lot to love. However, there is a real problem with quality testing here and Logitech has lost my business with this keyboard. I got the first one, and the WASD keys did not work at all...bit of a problem, especially for gamers. The second one worked fine for about 2 months and then the spacebar key became very unreliable and had to be pushed down hard for it to register. Add to that the unwieldy support software and the glitch prone LED lighting...just can't recommend this keyboard. Had such potential for the cost...but it's manufactured cheaply and is clearly not quality tested.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gaming keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I love how the keys feel on this keyboard and the programmable rgb lights are awesome. I use the keyboard for gaming and use it for playing fortnite. It performs as it should and the clickity clackaty sounds it makes is just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Juan McGee

customer_reviews.title: keys stick, or fail to work
customer_reviews.text: keys sometimes just start sticking, I don't think it is the physical keys, but possibly something with the software, but it just repeatedly inputs the key without the button being pressed. Sometimes keys just don't work. Unreliable, DO NOT BUY THIS KEYBOARD.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Nice ergonomic keyboard, well made.
customer_reviews.text: My wife saw another lady using a gaming keyboard at work and wanted one. She wanted it to be backlit and to be old school typewriter sounding. This has lots of colors and is just plug and play but it’s not very mechanical sounding. She’s not a gamer so I don’t know how it is for that. Very well built but you’ll have to research online to get details on how to control the lighting as there is no documentation in the package.
customer_reviews.author: George Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Buy for its looks
customer_reviews.text: I wish Logitech made a regular version of this keyboard that used its Setpoint software. Instead they fixed what wasn't broken and as result lost some functionality. Otherwise I love the rainbow colors, though the keys could be a little more clicky for my tastes.
customer_reviews.author: James Ko

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard for the Office
customer_reviews.text: I'm a gamer at home, but have a 8-5 office job and wanted a better keyboard then the generic Dell keybaord everyone has. This is a great entry level RGB Logitech keyboard. No REAL complaints, but if I had to picky here's what I would like to point out: -The keyboard wrist rest is not removable. If you're the type that takes these off, please don't buy this one. This was not a deal breaker for me -The Num\Caps\Scroll lock light is pretty darn bright. I ended up putting electrical tape over the Num lock with a few hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bresciano

customer_reviews.title: Not a Logitech. Still decent
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine. So I’m good. Only been using a couple weeks so far. WARNING: it’s not a Logitech. It’s some knockoff. I personally am ok w that as long as it lasts for at least a year for the price. But don’t assume your getting a quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: JLR

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use this if you are typing on it for 8 hours a day.
customer_reviews.text: The product was really good.. for 4 months. Keys started to stop working, I work in IT so I constantly type all day which could be the issue but regardless we have regular standard 10$ dell keyboards that have lasted 5 years on top of 3 shifts using them every day, theirs no excuse for the keys to stop. I’ve taken the keyboard apart and cleaned every key myself and blasted it with an air compressor to get all the dust out, and it still does not work. The lighting was incredibly disappointing as it was dull. Get a Corsair lol. Although the mouse that goes with it is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned up easy and still works great
customer_reviews.text: This thing literally took a full cocktail within the first weeks of usage. Cleaned up easy and still works great! I have the G710 which you are able to control each light in each key, so I was disappointed to find out this one did not have that capability. No deduction of review however, as it was significantly less expensive. :)
customer_reviews.author: Klint

customer_reviews.title: Nice affordable keyboard with some bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: I really like the overall design of this keyboard. The LEDs are bright and make the keys easy to see. The sloped design is easy on your wrists. The extras like the media buttons and joystick on/off are nice features. I'd definitely buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Duskbunny

customer_reviews.title: Colorful key lights and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this keyboard for my MacBook Pro 2014. Check out my video. The illumination keys are very beautiful especially during night time. For those people buying it for MacBook, don’t forget to get a usb hub since any MacBook before 2016 has only 2 ports. The male usb 3.0 to female usb c is needed for MacBook with usb c ports to work with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: EvaGao

customer_reviews.title: Was good while it lasted (3 months)
customer_reviews.text: I had no complaints until 3 months into ownership. Now there is key chatter on the B, U, V, R, and L keys. For those unaware of what key chatter is, it is when with one keystroke the board registers as more than one press. This results in duplicated letters and makes trying to type an exercise in frustration. Typing on this keyboard makes me look like Elmer Fudd having a stroke until I go back and remove every duplicated character.
customer_reviews.author: Anon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a broken G105. The key feel sucks, its gritty. Only thing important to me is it's the cheapest full keyboard you can get with a "gaming mode" button to disable window key. I don't need RGB but I guess I'm forced to have it if I want features for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Not working  properly
customer_reviews.text: After around a week or so of use the spacebar isn't working properly, significant delayswhen pressedaroundhalfthe time, as you can see. Now amazon wants me todropthis off to send itback in themiddle of a pandemic, and i cantevenleavethe housetodo so literally by law.
customer_reviews.author: vistachiri

customer_reviews.title: Great Membrane Keyboard w/ One Small Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Went from membrane to mechanical keyboard. Thought I wanted to give mechanical keyboards a try. Wasn't for me. So had to look for an alternative. Had to look for a membrane keyboard that sounds goods & feels good. Finally found this. Love the multimedia keys & the option to turn off the backlight. These options come in handy! The only small flaw is the stands are too long. Makes the keyboard stand too tall. If this was cut in half it'll be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Logitech G213 Prodigy Gaming Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This Keyboard is Fantastic, Pressing the Buttons are really good the Brightness is Not Very Bright but you still can see if your in the Dark, also comes with the Media Audio Buttons Volume Like: Silence, Up, Down, Play/Pause, Stop, Back Track & Next Track also you got one Button to Turn Off the Lights or Turn On the Lights just in case your wandering.
customer_reviews.author: David8508

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Less than a month of owning it and the space bar starting acting up. Most of the time the space bar would trigger twice, or it would be delayed. Made certain games unplayable. Update: I reached out to customer service and they made the return very easy and even sent me a new keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Libby Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Best Backlit Gaming Keyboard for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Have had a few cheap "backlit" keyboards that were ok for the money...However, for the money, this keyboard is amazing! I would seriously pay 2X and still be happy! If you actually type from time to time(and are good at it), the mechanics of this keyboard are unbelievably good!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Cooper

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Took a little learning curve to get the key light color I wanted and to get it to stay that way after shutting the computer off but all is well. The lighting is bright, but not too much. Perfect for dim rooms or even in broad daylight.
customer_reviews.author: A. LOPILATO

customer_reviews.title: Great littell key
customer_reviews.text: Great little keyboard for the price, works well, lots of cool colors schemes and So far am not disappointing in the quality of the product. Sad to see that color schemes available for the higher priced keyboards do not work on this one though.
customer_reviews.author: R. Meldrum

customer_reviews.title: If you don't like mechanical, this one's for you
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy it, basic as it is, and find it comfortable to use for general computing and gaming. Not the performance of a mechanical, but it's not so noisy either.
customer_reviews.author: kprime

customer_reviews.title: Low profile excellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This Keyboard is not flashy by any means. The RGB is subtle in the sense that it doesn't flash bright lights in your face. Typing on this feels nice and easy. It's loud but nowhere near mechanical loud (mic shouldnt pick this up). If you have a Logitech mouse or want something low profile, then this is for you. Only downside is the software and size. I wish the RGB had more options and the wrist rest being undetachable makes it a large keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: steven escobar

product_meta.title: Logitech G213 Gaming Keyboard with Dedicated Media Controls, 16.8 Million Lighting Colors Backlit Keys, Spill-Resistant and Durable Design, Black
product_meta.description: G213 Prodigy is a performance driven wired Logitech keyboard designed for gamers of all levels. Slim, durable, precise, and spill-resistant, G213 Prodigy is designed for the way you play. Personalize brilliant Logitech RGB color lighting and lighting patterns to match your style from a spectrum of 16. 8 million colors. Customize all 12 Function keys to quickly and accurately execute complex maneuvers. With performance-tuned keys, G213 Prodigy brings together the best in tactile feedback you can feel and gaming-grade performance. Keys are tuned to deliver ultra-quick, responsive feedback that is up to 4 times faster than the keys on standard keyboards, while the anti-ghosting gaming matrix prevents response delays even when you press multiple keys simultaneously. And with dedicated media controls, you can play, pause and mute music and videos instantly right from the keyboard.
feature_bullets: Prodigy Series Logitech G keyboard for advanced gaming-grade performance up to 4x faster than standard keyboards so every keypress is near instantaneous from fingers to screen
Brilliant Color Spectrum Illumination lets you easily personalize up to 5 lighting zones from over 16.8 million colors to match your style and gaming gear
Tactile performance keys tuned for gaming with responsive and more. LCD Display: No
Dedicated media control let you quickly play, pause, skip and adjust the volume of music right from the keyboard
Easily customize key lighting, 12 Function keys with custom commands, and more with free Logitech Gaming Software

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,310 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
